definition[0]: to move, drive, or push something forward
example[0]: a boat propelled by a small motor
example[1]: One of our students was unable to propel her wheelchair up the ramp.
example[2]: She used the sticks to propel herself along.
definition[1]: to make someone move in a particular direction, especially by pushing them
example[3]: He took her arm and propelled her towards the door.
definition[2]: to move someone into a new situation or make them do something
example[4]: The film propelled her to stardom.
example[5]: Company directors were propelled into action.
